name: Ibis Lyon Sud Saint Rambert d'Albon

reviews.text: Pretty much a "motel", but rooms quite sufficient, well heated (it was well below zero outside), staff friendly and willing to please, and the bar/restaurant quite cosy.
reviews.title: Better than expected!
St Rambert d'Albon
reviews.text: The stay we had had this hotel was extremely good. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable.
We had an evening meal in the restaurant and this was excellent. The service was also very good.
reviews.title: Small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to others
reviews.title: a like it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ibis are a major player but they need to re-evaluate their rooms. We are a family of three and the rooms are so small compared to newer competitors that offer family rooms. They are clean and and the food is OK (unfortunately that is going downhill though). I feel that competitors will start to take the market away from Accorr though if they don't improve what they offer.
reviews.title: Halfway house

description: The Ibis St Rambert d'Albon hotel is located among the orchards of the Drôme, 60 km south of Lyon, close to an exit of the A7, on the RN7 leading to Valence. It is close to the Facteur Cheval museum, the Safari Parc de Peaugres and Albon golf centre. The hotel offers 70 air-conditioned rooms with Wifi connection, including 3 adapted for disabled guests, and 1 meeting room. A restaurant, a bar, snacks 24/24, a terrace and closed parking are at your disposal. Pets accepted.
